Welcome to the Tips and Recommendations for Ingesting Psilocybin Survey (TRIPS)!  This study is a national survey about psilocybin use that aims to help us develop guidelines to help people reduce harm and maximize the benefits of using psilocybin. It will also help us understand how changing norms, attitudes, and beliefs about psilocybin will influence uptake of guidelines. This survey is being conducted by Simon Fraser University.  *Please note that in this survey use of the word “psilocybin” refers to what is more commonly known as ‘magic mushrooms’ or simply, ‘mushrooms’*  The information below describes the risks and benefits of participating in this study, provides an overview of what your participation entails, and describes how your data will be stored.  Study Procedure We are asking you to answer a confidential questionnaire. The survey will take approximately 10-15 minutes if you have not consumed psilocybin before and 20-25 minutes if you have. You may skip questions that you do not wish to answer, or stop at any time. We will also ask you to participate in a follow-up visit in six months. We will ask for your email address to contact you at that time. Participation in both the current survey and the follow-up survey in six months is completely voluntary.  Rights and Compensation This study is completely voluntary. At the end of each survey you complete, you will be automatically directed to a form that will allow you to enter a prize draw for a $100 prize, payable via e-transfer. You must provide your email address to enter. If you do not make it to the end of the survey, you will not be able to enter.  Potential Risks Some of the questions we ask will cause you to reflect on your experiences using psilocybin and your personal opinions about psilocybin use and it’s regulation. We also ask questions about your demographic background. Some individuals may experience stress or discomfort while answering these questions – particularly if they have had a history of stressful or traumatic social encounters. You may skip questions that you do not wish to answer or you may take a short break at any point in the survey. If you no longer want to complete the survey, you can simply close the browser window or skip the remaining questions to reach the end of the survey in order to enter the prize drawing. A resource list for mental health resources will be provided at the end of the survey.  If you feel like you are experiencing distress check out the resources below to get help:   • Canadian Crisis Line: 833-456-4566  • First Nations and Inuit Hope for Wellness: 855-242-3310 . • Trans LifeLine: 877-330-6366  • BetterHelp Counselling Services: www.betterhelp.com  Potential Benefits There are no direct benefits to you for participating in this survey. By participating you are helping us develop guidelines and recommendations for lower risk psilocybin use.  Removal of Data If you decide to quit the survey before finishing it, we will not be able to remove your data. We are also not able to remove your responses even if you complete the survey.  Confidentiality Your participation is completely voluntary and confidential. No attempt will be made to identify you based on your survey responses. The data collected may be shared at a later date with other researchers with an interest in validating or findings or conducting additional analyses, but your participation will remain confidential. If you provide your email address to enter the prize draw, we will ask if we can retain your email address so that you can be invited to participate in a longitudinal component of the survey. If you agree, we will retain your email address until the study is completed and will create an anonymous ID that will allow us to link survey responses between this survey and potential follow-up surveys related to psilocybin use. If you do not express interest in participating in the longitudinal component of the survey, your email address will be deleted after the winners are selected for the prize draw. We will never share the email address you provide with anybody outside of our study team and no outside parties will know have access to identifiable information about our survey participants.  Data collection and storage This survey is hosted on the Qualtrics Survey platform. As such, your data will be temporarily stored at a Qualtrics data centre in Canada. Once the study has concluded, this data will be downloaded to secure servers at Simon Fraser University and deleted from the Qualtrics platform.  Data Availability Results from this study will be published in a public report located on our study website (https://getpsyched.ca/) and shared through academic journals and conferences. The data you provide will be kept by the Principal Investigators on secure servers at Simon Fraser University. A public version of the data set will also be made available 1 year after the results of this study are published to allow other researchers to validate our results and explore additional hypotheses. This public version will not include any personally identifying information. No additional informed consent will be collected for use of data from this publicly available data set.  Contact for information about the study If you have any questions or need further information with respect to this study, you may contact Dr. Kiffer Card at kcard@sfu.ca.  Contact for concerns about the rights of research subjects If you have any concerns or complaints about your rights as a research participant and/or your experiences while participating in this study, you may contact the SFU Office of Research Ethics at dore@sfu.ca or 778-782-6593.  Consenting to this survey does not waive any rights to legal recourse in the event of research-related harm.   Do you agree to the terms above?

Now, we'd like your input on what you would describe as a "microdose", "light dose", "medium dose", "strong dose", and "Heavy dose."  Given that the dosage of psilocybin varies from mushroom to mushroom, please assume we are talking about DRIED P. cubensis (e.g., golden caps, liberty caps, golden teacher, penis envy) mushrooms.  How many grams of DRIED mushrooms would you consider each of the following dosage levels? Note: Please provide a minimum range and a maximum range for your estimates. - Microdose (e.g., no felt effects, possible improvements to mood) - Minimum

Thanks! Now we want to understand a bit about your own experiences with psilocybin before diving into some more discussions about these guidelines.  Have you ever consumed psilocybin at the following dosages (of dried mushrooms or equivalent)? Note: We understand that many people may not know the ammount of mushrooms they are consuming in a given dose -- particularly when ingesting as a chocolate, mushroom cap, stem, or other form. Please answer these questions to the best of your ability, with respect to the stated range of grams of dried mushrooms and the qualitative description of the dosage. Also note that the ranges provided may be different from those you shared -- which is totally okay! We are still working to refine these ranges! - A “microdose” (e.g., Less than 0.5 grams)

The next few questions are about why you use psilocybin. Because people can have many motives for use, we will ask this question in a few different ways so we can hone our understanding.  In your own words, why do you use psilocybin?

Below is a list of several broad reasons about why some people use psilocybin. How often are each of these reasons a motive for your using psilocybin? (If a motive does not apply to you, select "Not Applicable") - ... to enhance my senses (e.g., sight, taste, smell).

You should avoid mixing psilocybin with the following: - Alcohol
You should avoid mixing psilocybin with the following: - Tobacco
You should avoid mixing psilocybin with the following: - Cannabis
You should avoid mixing psilocybin with the following: - Depressants (e.g., GHB, Benzos)
You should avoid mixing psilocybin with the following: - Stimulant Drugs (e.g., Cocaine, Amphetamines)
You should avoid mixing psilocybin with the following: - Opioids (Codeine, Heroine, oxycodone)
You should avoid mixing psilocybin with the following: - Empathogen Drugs (e.g., MDMA)
You should avoid mixing psilocybin with the following: - Dissociatives (e.g., Ketamine, Nitrous oxide)
You should avoid mixing psilocybin with the following: - Other Psychedelics (e.g., LSD, Ayahuasca, DMT)
Is there any other advice you have about mixing psilocybin with other drugs?

The following statements are common recommendations and/or guidelines for safe psilocybin experience(s).  Please indicate how much you agree or disagree with each recommendation. - Consult with your doctor before using psilocybin

The following statements are common recommendations and/or guidelines for safe psilocybin experience(s).  Please indicate how much you agree or disagree with each recommendation. - It is best not to use psilocybin until you reach adulthood.

The following statements are common recommendations and/or guidelines for safe psilocybin experience(s).  Please indicate how much you agree or disagree with each recommendation. - Make sure you know how to contact the local emergency services while tripping.

The following statements are common recommendations and/or guidelines for safe psilocybin experience(s).  Please indicate how much you agree or disagree with each recommendation. - Pregnant people and people nursing should avoid using psilocybin.

The following statements are common recommendations and/or guidelines for safe psilocybin experience(s).  Please indicate how much you agree or disagree with each recommendation. - Do not take mushrooms if you are experiencing discomfort, pain, or illness.

The following statements are common recommendations and/or guidelines for safe psilocybin experience(s).  Please indicate how much you agree or disagree with each recommendation. - Abstain from using psilocybin if you are worried about people finding out.

The following statements are common recommendations and/or guidelines for safe psilocybin experience(s).  Please indicate how much you agree or disagree with each recommendation. - Avoid eating any potential psychedelic mushrooms you collect in the wild unless you are certain they are correctly identified.

The following statements are common recommendations and/or guidelines to prepare for using psilocybin. Please indicate how much you agree or disagree with each recommendation. - Psilocybin is a minimum two-day experience

The following statements are common recommendations and/or guidelines to prepare for using psilocybin. Please indicate how much you agree or disagree with each recommendation. - The 24 hours after tripping should be commitment free

The following statements are common recommendations and/or guidelines to prepare for using psilocybin. Please indicate how much you agree or disagree with each recommendation. - Avoid eating food 2-3 hours before consuming psilocybin

The following statements are common recommendations and/or guidelines to prepare for using psilocybin. Please indicate how much you agree or disagree with each recommendation. - Get 8+ hours of sleep the night before you plan to use.

The following statements are common recommendations and/or guidelines to prepare for using psilocybin. Please indicate how much you agree or disagree with each recommendation. - Get 8+ hours of sleep the night after you use.

The following statements are common recommendations and/or guidelines to prepare for using psilocybin. Please indicate how much you agree or disagree with each recommendation. - It is important to have a sober, trustworthy and preferably experienced person (trip-sitter) with you.

The following statements are common recommendations and/or guidelines to prepare for using psilocybin. Please indicate how much you agree or disagree with each recommendation. - Use a scale to weigh out how many mushrooms you eat.

The following statements are common recommendations and/or guidelines to prepare for using psilocybin. Please indicate how much you agree or disagree with each recommendation. - Have snacks and drinks with you before the trip begins

The following statements are common recommendations and/or guidelines to prepare for using psilocybin. Please indicate how much you agree or disagree with each recommendation. - When planning a mushroom experience, tell someone you trust how much you are taking.

The following statements are common recommendations and/or guidelines for creating a comfortable psilocybin experience.  Please indicate how much you agree or disagree with each recommendation. - The set and setting are the most important concepts to understand before using psilocybin.

The following statements are common recommendations and/or guidelines for creating a comfortable psilocybin experience.  Please indicate how much you agree or disagree with each recommendation. - Only take mushrooms if you are in a good mental state.

The following statements are common recommendations and/or guidelines for creating a comfortable psilocybin experience.  Please indicate how much you agree or disagree with each recommendation. - Ensure the environment that you will be tripping in is safe, comfortable, familiar, and pleasant.

The following statements are common recommendations and/or guidelines for creating a comfortable psilocybin experience.  Please indicate how much you agree or disagree with each recommendation. - When using psilocybin make sure you are in a positive mindset.

The following statements are common recommendations and/or guidelines for creating a comfortable psilocybin experience.  Please indicate how much you agree or disagree with each recommendation. - Take psilocybin in your home

The following statements are common recommendations and/or guidelines for creating a comfortable psilocybin experience.  Please indicate how much you agree or disagree with each recommendation. - Take  psilocybin in nature

The following statements are common recommendations and/or guidelines for creating a comfortable psilocybin experience.  Please indicate how much you agree or disagree with each recommendation. - Take  psilocybin in crowds

The following statements are common recommendations and/or guidelines for creating a comfortable psilocybin experience.  Please indicate how much you agree or disagree with each recommendation. - Take  psilocybin at concerts

The following statements are common recommendations and/or guidelines for creating a comfortable psilocybin experience.  Please indicate how much you agree or disagree with each recommendation. - Do not use psilocybin alone.

The following statements are common recommendations and/or guidelines for creating a comfortable psilocybin experience.  Please indicate how much you agree or disagree with each recommendation. - Know why you want to use psilocybin.

The following statements are common recommendations and/or guidelines for creating a comfortable psilocybin experience.  Please indicate how much you agree or disagree with each recommendation. - Do not use psilocybin while in a crowded, busy area, or in any other area with environmental hazards.

The following statements are common recommendations and/or guidelines for creating a comfortable psilocybin experience.  Please indicate how much you agree or disagree with each recommendation. - Wait up to 1 hour before taking more psilocybin as it may take time to feel the effects of your first dose.
Do you have any additional comments about the recommendations above?

The following statements are common recommendations and/or guidelines for maximizing your psilocybin experience. Please indicate how much you agree or disagree with each recommendation. - Listening to music while on psilocybin is a good way to reduce any feelings of anxiety.

The following statements are common recommendations and/or guidelines for maximizing your psilocybin experience. Please indicate how much you agree or disagree with each recommendation. - Journaling after your psychedelic experience can help with retaining lessons learned during the psychedelic experience.

The following statements are common recommendations and/or guidelines for maximizing your psilocybin experience. Please indicate how much you agree or disagree with each recommendation. - If you start to have a bad trip it is best to breath slowly, stay calm, and move to a safe environment to help ease the bad trip.

The following statements are common recommendations and/or guidelines for maximizing your psilocybin experience. Please indicate how much you agree or disagree with each recommendation. - To avoid developing a tolerance wait at least a couple of days between trips.

The following statements are common recommendations and/or guidelines for maximizing your psilocybin experience. Please indicate how much you agree or disagree with each recommendation. - While on psilocybin avoid having sex with anyone other than a comfortable, familiar partner.
Are there any recommendations that are not listed above that you think are important for people who are new to using psilocybin?
Where do you like to consume psilocybin and what are good characteristics of locations where people can use it?

In the following section we are asking about your opinions related to psilocybin use, and to what extent it should be regulated.   Please rate your level of agreement with each of the following statements. - People should not be fined for using psilocybin.

In the following section we are asking about your opinions related to psilocybin use, and to what extent it should be regulated.   Please rate your level of agreement with each of the following statements. - People should not be jailed for using psilocybin.

In the following section we are asking about your opinions related to psilocybin use, and to what extent it should be regulated.   Please rate your level of agreement with each of the following statements. - Cops should not take psilocybin away from people who have it.

Please rate your level of agreement with each of the following statements. - Adults should be able to purchase psilocybin products much like they do cannabis or alcohol.

In the following section we are asking about your opinions related to psilocybin use, and to what extent it should be regulated.   Please rate your level of agreement with each of the following statements. - Doctors should be allowed to easily prescribe ‘medical psilocybin’ to patients.

In the following section we are asking about your opinions related to psilocybin use, and to what extent it should be regulated.   Please rate your level of agreement with each of the following statements. - The only acceptable legal usage of psilocybin should be if it is administered by a medical professional for extreme cases.

In the following section we are asking about your opinions related to psilocybin use, and to what extent it should be regulated.   Please rate your level of agreement with each of the following statements. - Adults should legally be able to use psilocybin.

In the following section we are asking about your opinions related to psilocybin use, and to what extent it should be regulated.   Please rate your level of agreement with each of the following statements. - Children should legally be able to use psilocybin.

Note: By disability we mean any impairment, including a physical, mental, intellectual, cognitive, learning, communication or sensory impairment — or a functional limitation — whether permanent, temporary or episodic that can harm a person’s full and equal participation in society.

The questions on the following page are about your experiences growing up as a child. Some of the questions are of a sensitive nature and deal with topics relating to abuse. These questions are important for understanding your life history. However, we understand that some people may not want to answer these questions.  Also, we wanted to remind you that if you feel like you are experiencing distress while answer these questions, you can use the resources below to get help:  • Canadian Crisis Line: 833-456-4566  • First Nations and Inuit Hope for Wellness: 855-242-3310.  • LifeLine: 877-330-6366  • BetterHelp Counselling Services: www.betterhelp.com    Do you want to answer these questions?
Growing up, before the age of 18... - Did you have at least one caregiver with whom you felt safe?
Growing up, before the age of 18... - Did you have at least one good friend?
Growing up, before the age of 18... - Did you have beliefs that gave you comfort?
Growing up, before the age of 18... - Did you experience joy at school?
Growing up, before the age of 18... - Did you have at least one teacher that cared?
Growing up, before the age of 18... - Did you have good neighbours?
Growing up, before the age of 18... - Did you have an adult (other than a parent or caregiver) who could provide you with support or advice?
Growing up, before the age of 18... - Did you like yourself or feel comfortable with yourself?
Growing up, before the age of 18... - Did you have a predictable home routine, like regular meals and a regular bedtime?
Growing up, before the age of 18... - Did you have opportunities to have a good time?
Growing up, before the age of 18... - Were you able to talk with your family about your feelings?
Growing up, before the age of 18... - Did you feel that your family stood by you during difficult times
Growing up, before the age of 18... - Did you enjoy participating in community traditions?
Growing up, before the age of 18... - Did you feel a sense of belonging in high school?
Growing up, before the age of 18... - Did you have at least two non-parent adults who took a genuine interest in you?
Growing up, before the age of 18... - Did you feel safe and protected by an adult in your home?
Growing up, before the age of 18... - Did you feel supported by your friends?

Growing up, before the age of 18... - Did a parent or other adult in the household often … Swear at you, insult you, put you down, or humiliate you? OR Act in a way that made you afraid that you might be physically hurt?
Growing up, before the age of 18... - Did a parent or other adult in the household often … Push, grab, slap, or throw something at you? OR Ever hit you so hard that you had marks or were injured?

Growing up, before the age of 18... - Did an adult or person at least 5 years older than you ever… Touch or fondle you or have you touch their body in a sexual way? OR Try to or actually have oral, anal, or vaginal sex with you?

Growing up, before the age of 18... - Did you often feel that … No one in your family loved you or thought you were important or special? OR Your family didn’t look out for each other, feel close to each other, or support each other?

Growing up, before the age of 18... - Did you often feel that … You didn’t have enough to eat, had to wear dirty clothes, and had no one to protect you? OR Your parents were too drunk or high to take care of you or take you to the doctor if you needed it?
Growing up, before the age of 18... - Were your parents ever separated or divorced?

Growing up, before the age of 18... - Was your mother or stepmother: Often pushed, grabbed, slapped, or had something thrown at her? OR Sometimes or often kicked, bitten, hit with a fist, or hit with something hard? OR Ever repeatedly hit over at least a few minutes or threatened with a gun or knife?
Growing up, before the age of 18... - Did you live with anyone who was a problem drinker OR alcoholic or who used street drugs?
Growing up, before the age of 18... - Was a household member depressed or mentally ill? OR Did a household member attempt suicide?
Growing up, before the age of 18... - Did a household member go to prison?
